force-language.description: Whether to send all strings translated to server locale or let the device handle them

shutdown-message.description: Message to show when kicking players on server shutdown

profile-report-trigger.description: Will only collect timings when the TPS is below this value

async-workers.description: Number of threads used for processing background tasks such as generation, compression, web requests and plugin async tasks.

enable-dev-builds.description: Whether to allow dev builds to run.  Dev builds might crash, break your plugins, corrupt your world and more.

global-limit.description: Global soft memory limit (MB). When reached, low-memory triggers will fire to try and free memory.

main-limit.description: Main thread soft memory limit (MB). When reached, low-memory triggers will fire to try and free memory.

main-hard-limit.description: Main thread hard memory limit (MB). The server will crash if more than this amount of memory is used by the main thread.

async-worker-hard-limit.description: Async worker thread hard memory limit (MB). Workers will crash if they try to use more than this amount of memory.

check-rate.description: Period in server ticks to check memory usage.

continuous-trigger.description: Whether to repeatedly fire low memory triggers and events until soft limits are no longer being exceeded.

continuous-trigger-rate.description: After this many memory checks, low memory limits will be triggered again (only if continuous-trigger is true).

period.description: Period in server ticks to run memory garbage collection (default 30 minutes).

collect-async-worker.description: Whether to collect garbage from async workers.

low-memory-trigger.description: Trigger garbage collection when soft memory limits are exceeded

dump-async-worker.description: Whether to dump memory from async workers when using /dumpmemory.

chunk-radius.description: Cap player render distances when soft memory limits are exceeded.

trigger-chunk-collect.description: Whether to force immediate unloading of unused chunks when soft memory limits are exceeded.

disable-chunk-cache.description: Whether to allow adding new caches to network chunk packet cache when soft memory limits are exceeded.

low-memory-trigger.description: Whether to clear network chunk packet cache when soft memory limit is exceeded.

batch-threshold.description: Packets over this size in bytes will be compressed. 0 compresses everything, -1 disables compression.

compression-level.description: Zlib compression level for packets. Higher = more CPU, less bandwidth usage.

async-compression.description: Whether to always use async workers for compression. Improves overall performance, but slightly increases latency.

upnp-forwarding.description: Whether to attempt automatic portforwarding using UPnP.

max-mtu-size.description: Maximum size of packets sent over the network. Packets larger than this will be split into smaller parts before sending.

enable-encryption.description: Whether to encrypt Minecraft network traffic.

level.description: Level of debug messages to show in the console. Options are 1 (no debug) and 2 (debug).

verify-xuid.description: Whether to check that joining players' XUIDs match the last recorded XUID (prevents impersonation attacks).

default-format.description: Name of the format to use for generating new worlds by default.

per-tick.description: Maximum number of chunks to send to each player per tick. Higher values cause faster terrain loading, but potentially more lag.

spawn-radius.description: Radius of chunks to send during player join before spawning.

per-tick.description: Maximum number of chunks ticked per world per tick.

tick-radius.description: Radius of chunks around each player to tick.

blocks-per-subchunk-per-tick.description: Number of blocks ticked per subchunk in chunks chosen for ticking. Higher values cause trees and plants to grow faster, but with more lag.

disable-block-ticking.description: IDs of blocks to disallow ticking.

population-queue-size.description: Maximum number of chunks to generate/populate concurrently.

autosave.description: Number of server ticks between automatic world saves.

enabled.description: Whether to upload crash reports automatically

send-code.description: Whether to include a sample of code (usually 20 lines) around the crash location in crashdumps.

send-settings.description: Whether to include server settings (pocketmine.yml, server.properties) in crashdumps.

send-phpinfo.description: Whether to include information in crashdumps about the PHP binary used to run the server.

use-https.description: Whether to use HTTPS to communicate with the crash archive server.

host.description: IP or URL of the crash archive server.

enabled.description: Whether to periodically upload anonymous statistics to the stats server.

host.description: IP or URL of the stats server.

enabled.description: Whether to enable notifications about new versions.

warn-console.description: Whether to log a message on the console if a new version is available.

preferred-channel.description: Channel to check for updates in.

suggest-channels.description: Whether to suggest changing preferred-channel if running a build not from that channel.

host.description: IP or URL of the update API host.
IP or URL of the timings server.

title-tick.description: Whether to enable status reporting on the window title bar.

seed.description: Seed to use for generating this world.

generator.description: Name of the generator to use to generate this world.

preset.description: Generator-specific preset info to customize the generation of the world.

difficulty.description: Name or ID of the difficulty level to use in this world.

worlds.description: Settings for loading and/or generating multiple worlds.

legacy-data-dir.description: Whether to store plugin data in plugins directory instead of plugin_data.
